Twas a weird hour I spent in this joint...

I was already drunk when I came down from my hotel room, intent on going to Burger King for onion rings (the only reason I was going to eat said rings was for their fart power, which I intended to release up on my buddies who'd wimped out upstairs.) But, BK was closed so  I decided to swing over for a drink.  I was drawn to Club 93 because it was the only open bar I knew of in the area, and because the name of the place, about which I was actually mistaken, appealed to me.  Due to a scrawled sign above the door, I initially thought it was called "Shuffleboard"

The bar was spacious and empty, dirty and bright... all of this in an oddly appealing way.  The bartender was nowhere to be found, but there was a big crazy dude at the end of the bar (bonus) and a hot girl sharing a drink with what appeared to be her husband.  When I heard that her friends were going to be joining them, I decided I'd wait for the bartender.  The tattooed drink maiden eventually emerged a good 10 minutes later from her crack-smoking lair in the back.  She was friendly enough, but definitely zonked.  When I later got the bill, I was surprised to find the total was accurate.  

Eventually the hot girl's friends came, and they were all attractive lasses, which enticed me to stay on for a bit longer.  Also, I didn't want to go to bed so I stuck around a bit.  Things never got interesting and the time spent there would fall into the "filler" category of my life's unmade tv series.

Overall this place is a dive's dive and I'd recommend it if you're going with a group. There is pool, a juke box and a shuffleboard table (which was covered when I got there) and doesn't seem to be populated by hostile locals (I didn't get any mean looks, only curious ones)  The booze selection isn't amazing but you'll find something you'll like.  Unfortunately, waiting 10 minutes, just to see the bartender, is lame no matter what the place... be it a crowded hot spot or an empty shithole.
author: jorbi p.

description: Club 93 is a Bar in real sense.. they have over 14 drafts of beers... every kind of hard liquor... welcome hospitality... n' the JUKEBOX seems like it is from Tron-world... not one but two pool tables which takes away the waiting time... n' for the people who juss come there to have a few drinks.. chit-chat.. n' have a merry time... its a sweet little friendly place... n' the club always has something special going on.. Burlesque.. live music... different kinds of shows...for me.. I just love going there for a drink or few n' the kind of environment it has takes away all my stress away!!! I never feel like leaving a review for any place that I go whether it nice or not... but this Bar.. Club 93 is jusss different!!! Check it Out!!!
author: Rinkesh P.

description:
Yeah, whatever Sean P., I'm doin' it. =)

I'm writing a review of this place!

Friends randomly discovered this place, I don't know how.  But after some drinks at a club, we took a cab to meet them here.  Having never been here, no idea what to expect.

Divey divey diiiiiiiiiiiive.

Before I knew it someone had ordered shots of buttery nipples for everyone and we were linked arms belting out Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody".  Good times at a bar that has nothing truly remarkable inside to offer except no line for drinks and a fucking awesome (and available) jukebox.
author: Mary R.

description: For the last week (and one more to go) I am dog sitting for a friend on vacation around the corner from Club 93. I live in the mission and don't wander these streets all that often on my own, so for the first few days I simply walked by peering inside to try to get a vibe. After a few days a friend and I decided to go bar hopping on a random Tuesday or something (this is normal for us) to bars we'd never been to in the area. We hit up some swanky place on Minna first (his choice) and then went to Club 93 after (my choice). It was awesome! The bartender and owner were friendly. Service was good. Drinks were cheap, and music was on the spot. Ever since then, I've been back just about every night to get a quick night cap. Every time I go in there I meet nice people and feel comfortable, safe, and welcome. I have since requested a few different friends of mine to join me at Club 93 for a drink or a quick game of pool. We always leave with smiles on our faces and money left in our pockets. I can't wait until my friend comes back from his trip to the Land Down Under so I can show him this jem that is less than a block from his front door.
author: Sarah J.

description: They have free pool and shuffleboard on Sunday and a decent selection of beers on tap.  It's a total dive, and you have to love it for that.  It's less seedy than its facade.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Damn you Club 93!   I used to go here when it was Rich's Club 93 and even had this dope portrait to give them that he said he'd put up in the bar - score!  Of course then it changes hands and now it's the Club 93.

It just doesn't have that homey charm it used to when it was Rich's.  It's more a standard divey bar.  Pool tables in the back, random juke box, and an interesting assortment of denizens.
author: Gene X.

description: Great dive bar, friendly patrons! Be sure to stop in when Elysha is working and say hello to her!
author: Courtney S.

description:
I don't know if it's fair to call "The Club" a dive bar... it's like no place else I've ever been. It's sign says it's "In a league of it's own," and they couldn't be more right. This place is around the corner from my house and my brother and his best friend discovered it when they went to buy $2 40s, but the convienience store was closed. The next day I found out they hung out all night with a man who had SIN tattooed on his neck, had shots bought for them by a bum, and almost got in a fight.

I had to see this place for myself. In the 2 times I've been back, (once with my bro and once with my female roommates) here is what I've witnessed:
-After running out of pitchers, I was served Budwiser in a blender.
-The bartender microwaved a huge Gladware container of pasta and served some of the less fiscally blessed patrons.
-She also kept leaving the bar to play pool, so she let a regular step behind and do her job.
-After having numerous drinks bought for us by a gay man with terrible breath and his boyfriend, the two regulars promptly walked out on their tab.
-Never once was I asked if I wanted to start a tab, it's kinda just assumed.
-My bartender made us free buttery nipple shots, for dessert, I think as a present for being the only women in the place.

The list goes on and on. You have to see it to believe it. Bottom line, go here if you want to drink cheaply/for free but are willing to chat with men who, like Club 93, are in a league of their own.
author: Jennie H.

description: OK, Sarah and Nik are the best bartenders in SF.  Sarah is fucking hott with two ts and Nik is an asshole but knows how to pour a drink and listen to my bullshit.
author: California B.

description:
Worst dive bar I have ever been to. What's up with the owner? He is creepy... The whole time he was staring at us. We paid for our 'overprized' drinks and left asap. The bartenders ......what'sup with that mess!.

Definately avoid this spot if you are a female!
author: l s.

description: I come to club 93 maybe once or twice a week and I've literally never had a bad experience here. I work in the industry as a bartender and love going to a place like this on my days off. The bartenders here have always been beyond nice as well as super attentive. For me personally its just a really good place to kick it alone or with a crew of people. I defenitely recommend checking it out, especially because they do any beer and any shot for $10's all the time.
author: Scotty L.

description: Club 93 is no longer closed.  It's been purchased by the nicest guy ever, who really knows how to work it.  It's a dive bar through and through, but the new owner is extremely kind, and his bartender was a complete sweetheart.  If you're looking to shoot pool and play a jukebox and a real down-to-earth dive bar, well, look no further.  Club 93 is your place.
author: Randy F.

description: I don't care what other people say about this place. I love it. It's sleazy, everyone knows me as soon as I walk in, and AJ keeps me happy. It's a great place, great intentions. I admit they could do a bit more in terms of entertainment, but it's a great spot to meet interesting people you might not otherwise meet. A lot of people here have really interesting stories, and if you spend a night here, I promise you'll remember it.
author: Alycia M.

description: Nice selction of over a dozen draft bears as well as a full bar.  Two pool tables in the rear. Pleasant and accommodating bartenders.  Close to Holiday Inn and Hotel Whitcomb.  Good clean casual fun.
author: Jerry H.

description:
I love this place and its right in my neighborhood. If anyone tells me "i love dive bars, that's why I go to Zeitgeist" I hit them over the head with my beer and then take them here. My friend and I poured our own beers from across the bar one night because the bartender just left to smoke pot and never came back. 

brilliant.
author: Julia K.

description:
wow.. this place is awful... the bartenders are extremely slow.. ugly and the drinks are sloppy.

i went here in between meeting someone for drinks and this place .... smells like BO..

old man smell.. and toothless homies... 

yuck
author: tanner r.

description:
Well, it's a bar. And it's half a block from my work. If it's not half a block from your work, I wouldn't recommend going out of your way. But, but the main draw was the shuffleboard. Shuffleboard is fun, and not many bars offer the shuffleboard adventure. So I convinced my roommate to meet me for drinks after work one day and shuffleboard session. My roommate claims this is the diviest bar in SF and possibly on the entire west coast, but that may be a slight exaggeration. I digress. The shuffleboard table was covered with all types of sh*& that the bartender and another patron nicely helped remove and get this thing up and running. It looked like it hadn't been in use for anything except leaning on since the late 70's, but it was a shuffleboard table. The great search for the pucks to play took about, oh another 20 minutes. But then it was on. Pretty intense game ensued. I came out the winner I believe. No bragging though, it was my roommates first shuffleboard experience. 

If this bar was a movie it would be a mix of horror and drama comedy. Hope that helps.
author: Robert C.

description: I have been enjoying this spot for the past two years.  The patrons are friendly and the bartenders are very attentive to your drinking needs. A.J. in particular is a wonderful bartender, always game for good conversation and offers many great drink deals.  My favorite is the top shelf tequila and beer special, can't beat it! Good tunes are playing and there is a variety of games including pool. Highly suggest this establishment for a wonderful, casual good time out!
author: rene r.

description: A bar in no-man's land. Seedy little spot that's really not a destination, but makes for a great place to sit and have a brew before a show at the civic center.
author: Michael E.

description: I come here for a beer sometimes.  It is a strange bar.  Not quite a dive, although from the clientele that would be the assumption; but no it is not a dive.  $4 PBR's and Buds prevent it from being a dive.  And the people that go there prevent it from being an appealing bar.
author: Anthony Y.

description: I won't really get into great detail as to how I ended up here various times, but it truly is a comfortable place to get sloshed, play some ancient pinballesque games or pool, and a great jukebox...Bartender (can't remember her name) has always taken good care of me & my buds.  ONly drawback to this place is its location...nothin much else nearby...Except All-star Donuts across the street! =)
author: Gio G.

description: This place used to have a heart, but ever since new owner AJ took over, the bar is a sad excuse for a way to spend a night out drinking.  I was constantly hassled by bums outside while in and out of the bar.  the bathroom smell seeps into the bar.  2 terrible songs are played over and over on the jukebox..  the drinks are average price, but never stiff as they should be in a dive bar.  Id rather walk to blocks to folsom st.
author: barb p.

description: haha this place is funny...i dont really think u can call this place a "dive bar" as it just has a different feeling from other "dive bars", I'd consider this more a "Ghetto Bar"...by the way those pictures must have been like taken years ago because that is in no way how the bar looks, it looks more run down then that...  There are old cash registers, boxes and old kegs lined up on the walls and floors, and the shuffle board is not functional as it has junk on top of it...we actually went there because of shuffle board, so it was unfortunate that it was outta commission.  the place is definitely a dump no doubt, but at least you dont have to wait in line to play pool there...the bartender also really likes to play michael jackson on the jukebox there I've noticed...not a terrible place, just a ghetto place, also the beers are $4, i'd expect it to be a little cheaper considering...
author: christopher h.

description: This place is amazing, I spent the better half of my bday there the other day.  I didnt know where to go and just happened to go to this amazing bar where i was treated like a queen by the friendly bar staff.  There was a drunk man and his friend who happened to come into the bar and continued to pester my girlfriends and I.  Not only where they twice our age but totally drunk.  The owner and the bartender were the only ones trying to help us.  The man who bashed this bar because they wouldn't let him play the piano is one of the two drunk idiots who thought they were cool talking to us even though we tried to make it obvious we didn't want to talk to them.  The owner and bartender saw how uncomfortable we were so when the owner didn't respond to the man in a way that was desirable, he got all mad and left.... and then our night got better!  So, to the man who wrote about hating this gem of a local bar, don't act like such an ignorant out- of -towner next time.  We love Club 93!!!
author: G V.
